nodes.text: Pammant Docks, also known as the Pammant Shipyards, was a shipwright company that at one time held a partnership with the Quarren organization known as the Free Dac Volunteers Engineering Corps. During the Clone Wars, Pammant Docks was allied with the Confederacy of Independent Systems, being represented by the Quarren official Tikkes.

While the early Confederacy navy was made up of heavily armed bulk transports from CIS member corporations, Pammant Docks and other allies constructed capital ships to create a creditable navy for the Separatists, such as the Subjugator-class heavy cruiser. These new starships were crewed by B1-series battle droids and filled with a variety of starfighters. The Separatist allied Quarren at Pammant Docks allowed for a large number of starships to be produced quickly for the Separatists. After a warship assembled from old Confederacy of Independent Systems' vessels attacked the Imperial facility Sentinel Base, the Galactic Empire began looking into if Pammant Docks or the volunteers had been involved in the warship's assembly.

Pammant Docks was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in Tarkin, a 2015 novel written by James Luceno and published by Del Rey. It was originally mentioned in Star Wars Legends continuity in Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith Incredible Cross-Sections, a 2005 reference book written by Curtis Saxton and published by Dorling Kindersley as part of the Incredible Cross-Sections series.
